content:
this is cool! pasted image

You get it by typing / in an empty compose box.

Thoughts on:

  • Lowering the font-weight after /me, /poll, etc.?
  • What should the description be for /me? Maybe /me waves hello (IRC-style action message)?

Also how hard is it to add other commands? Like /status out sick (sets status message), /settings (opens settings), /search foo, etc?
Lowering font weight sounds good
I think the current text for /me is good
Most other char products have that feature so no reason to mention irc
Not hard to add others to that feature at all
@Pragati Agrawal did the work for what we have now
/me is considered an 'emote', maybe?

I guess I'd never heard of /me being tied to actions. Also "/me is excited" is not an action? How about the following?
"/me waves hello (Action message)"
Yeah, I think that's great.

Yeah, adding more features would be quite easy, as we already had /settings before for testing purpose, It would be easy to implement it again.
Should I open a PR for the above-discussed changes?
@Pragati Agrawal sure!
Okay! :slight_smile:
Showing Zulip to friends, this is one of the features that really caused a, "woah, cool," reaction. So way to go @Pragati Agrawal !

For the text and options, how about the following?

/add @**name** (Add user to stream)
/call (Start a video call)
/me waves hello (Send an action message)
/mute (Mute or unmute topic)
/night (Toggle night mode)
/pm (Send a private message)
/poll Where should we go for lunch? (Create a poll)
/search (Open search)
/settings (Open settings)
/status in a meeting (Set a status)

Just to check, for things like /settings is it possible to do the action after typing /sett + Enter? I.e. without having to hit "Send" or having a message appear?
Our current setup includes hitting "send" but does not require a message to appear.
Some of those seem weird -- what are you expecting /call to do?

(Also, is /night actually something folks want to do? My experience is that most users just want a dark or light theme on their computer, and don't actually toggle the UI of tools they are using daily)

/night is partly to advertise the feature, but we can leave it out.

/call would right now just send a message like [Click to join video call](https://meet.jit.si//789302520896803)

Our current setup includes hitting "send" but does not require a message to appear.

got it. Is this easy to change? If not I can cull the list a bit.
Not sure. I think it might be weird for these to take effect after typeahead completion -- we don't have other typeahead actions that actually do things.

yeah, that's fair. Okay, how about

/add #**stream1** #**stream2** @**user1** @**user2** (Add users to streams)
/me waves hello (Send an action message)
/mute (Mute or unmute topic)
/pm @**name** (Send a private message)
/poll Where should we go for lunch? (Create a poll)
/search text (Perform a search)
/settings (Open settings)
/status in a meeting (Set a status)

(Removed /call and /night, and edited a few others)
@Wyatt Hoodes Thankyou! Pleased to hear that your friends like Zulip and its features. :)

While reading through the list of commands I was wondering wether /search searches in the current stream or in all message. Maybe this can be clarified? /search text (Perform a search for text in current stream) or whatever the behaviour is
yeah, I thought about that. We could do /search text (Search all messages).

I am curious if other folks use "/day" and "/night", which are already implemented. I use them quite a bit, but to be fair, it's mostly while doing CSS work or helping to reproduce bugs. (The context here is I'm wondering why they were removed from the list of commands.)

@Steve Howell I think the theory was that they're primarily used for testing the slash commands system; I'm probably fine including them if there's a real use case (even if it's primarily for developers to test things)
